articles.title: North Side to Inter-Korean Military Talks Warns South Side to Behave Itself
articles.content:
North Side to Inter-Korean Military Talks Warns South Side to Behave Itself

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean Peninsula is now standing on the crossroads of dialogue or confrontation and peace or war. 
					
					 Public at home and abroad affirmatively appreciate the atmosphere of a series of dialogues created with much effort and hope to see the north-south relations improved and national reconciliation and unity attained on this occasion. 
					
					 The military warmongers and other puppet conservative forces of south Korea, however, are getting frantic with the moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK as evidenced by intrusions into the north side's waters in the West Sea of Korea and the scattering of leaflets over areas along the front, a blatant challenge to the national aspiration and the demand of the times. 
					
					 In September alone, more than 80 warships of the south Korean navy intruded into the waters of the north side in the sea while anti-communist rightwing conservative organizations scattered a lot of leaflets and undesirable USBs and pamphlets into areas of the north side. 
					
					 A particular mention should be made of the fact that anti-communist elements under the Federation of the Movement for Freedom in the North unhesitatingly opened to public their plan to scatter anti-DPRK leaflets from the Rimjin Pavilion on the anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 The reckless actions of the anti-DPRK confrontation elements to slander the headquarters of our revolution and the socialist system have reached an intolerable phase. 
					
					 The head of the DPRK side delegation to the north-south general-level military talks sent the following warning notice to the south side on Saturday in this regard:
					
					 The south side has become reckless in its intrusion into the waters of our side and scattering of anti-DPRK leaflets over areas along the Military Demarcation Line, going against the trend of the favorably developing situation. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have so far watched with vigilance what the south side is seeking after its reckless actions, repressing their growing anger. 
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the south side's provocations which have gone beyond tolerance limit are such crimes against the nation and peace as chilling the atmosphere of reconciliation which has begun to return, an open perfidy of all the agreements between the north and the south which they promised to implement before the nation and a total breach of the Armistice Agreement signed in the eyes of the world. 
					
					 The south side will never deny the fact that the intrusions into the waters of the north side and scattering of leaflets against it are not simple provocations but open war actions against it. 
					
					 The north side reminds the south side once again that the army and people of the DPRK are compelled to make a physical retaliation against the south side's ceaseless provocative war moves as already clarified before the world and keeping themselves fully ready for it. 
					
					 The south side should face up to the prevailing situation and take a wise option on the crossroads of reconciliation and cooperation or physical confrontation. 
					
					 The south side would be well advised to think twice over the final notice of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Greetings to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greeting to Ugandan President

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, on the 49th anniversary of its independence.
					
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future.
					
					 He wished the president and the people of Uganda greater success in their work to consolidate the political stability of the country and achieve the economic development.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to President Kim Il Sung

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, and staff members of the mission laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Ryongnam Hill here on Saturday on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They placed the floral basket before the statue and paid tribute to the President.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Demonstrating Spirit of Songun Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Demonstrating Spirit of Songun Korea

					Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday dedicates a signed article to the first anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea is the Great Party that Victoriously Carries the Revolutionary Cause of Comrade Kim Il Sung to Completion".
					
					 The work, published on October 8, 2010, says that the WPK ushered in a new great surge in revolution and construction, in the efforts to win fresh victory of revolution through the Songun revolutionary leadership and the Songun politics by developing the idea of giving importance to the army and the Songun idea of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The work reflects the iron will of Kim Jong Il to realize the idea and the cause of the President to the last by strengthening the party and steadily enhancing its leadership role.
					
					 The work serves as an inspiring banner as it instilled redoubled strength and courage into the army and the people of the DPRK advancing toward the new victory of the Juche-oriented revolution, true to the spirit of the WPK Conference, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The socialist cause of Juche started by the President is advancing on a new and higher stage in its development under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. For the WPK, the leader's idea means the idea of the party and the leader's leadership the one of the party. The history of building a revolutionary party of the working class knows no such party as the WPK which holds in high esteem the great founder and builder of the party as the eternal leader and which firmly ensured the uniqueness of the idea and the leadership generation after generation and led the socialist cause to victory.
					
					 The party's leadership is the lifeline of the uninterrupted revolution. There is no other road for us than carrying out the revolution to the last under the uplifted red flag of socialism.
					
					 Juche-oriented socialism advancing under the leadership of the party is a science and victory. Steadfast is the faith of the army and the people as they are ready to keep to the road of revolution started by the President under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper calls upon all of them to get united around the WPK Central Committee headed by Kim Jong Il, powerfully demonstrate the spirit of Songun Korea and make the DPRK shine more brilliantly as the socialist power of Juche.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists stormed the royal palace of the feudal state of Ri Dynasty on October 8, 1895 and stabbed Queen Min, wife of the 26th King Kojong, to death. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday runs a bylined article in this regard. 
					
					 It says:
					
					 The incident known as "Ulmi Incident" clearly proved that the Japanese imperialists are the sworn enemy of the Korean people and a group of ferocious murderers who paid no heed to international law and ethics and morality. 
					
					 Queen Min was one of those who represented the state power at that time and the royal palace was considered a divine place symbolic of the state sovereignty. The murder of the queen was a crime against humanity rare to be found in history and wanton violation of sovereignty and dignity of Korea and hideous state-sponsored crime against the Korean nation. It was worked out and executed according to Japan's policy for aggression on Korea. 
					
					 After their illegal occupation of Korea early in the 20th century the Japanese imperialists enforced harsh colonial fascist rule for more than four decades, imposing untold misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean people. 
					
					 66 years have passed since the Japanese imperialists' defeat. However, Japan is still resorting to cunning moves to escape from the responsibility for its past crimes, far from making an apology and reparation. What is more serious is the Japanese reactionaries' distortion of the past crimes of the Japanese imperialists in the history textbooks. This is aimed to imbue the younger generation with militarism and put forward them as a shock brigade for a new war and thus realize their old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere".
					
					 These moves on the part of the Japanese reactionaries only harden the determination and will of the army and people of the DPRK to settle accounts with Japan to the last. 
					
					 Japan should clearly understand the hatred of the army and people of the DPRK for Japan and the national independent spirit of the Koreans and opt for redeeming its past at an early date. The settlement of the past is a key to the improved relations between the DPRK and Japan and herein lies the future of Japan.

articles.title: Lao Ambassador Gives Reception to Mark WPK Birthday
articles.content:
Lao Ambassador Gives Reception to Mark WPK Birthday

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak hosted a reception at his embassy on Saturday as regards the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the successful visit to the DPRK by Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and officials of the International Affairs Department of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 Staff members of the Lao embassy attended.
					
					 Chaleune Warinthrasak said in his speech at the reception that the friendly relations between Laos and the DPRK provided by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung have a long history.
					
					 The current meeting between Choummaly Sayasone and leader Kim Jong Il was a great event in boosting the bilateral relations, he noted.
					
					 The Lao party, government and people will make positive efforts to boost the relations between the two countries.
					
					 Kim Yong Il noted in his speech that the meeting between Kim Jong Il and President Choummaly Sayasone served as a historic event which demonstrated the vitality of the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Laos.
					
					 He referred to the positive struggle waged by the Lao people to defend the socialist gains, consolidate the people's democratic system and strengthen the state power as a whole.
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people will make efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he said.

articles.title: Chinese Tourists Arrive in DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Tourists Arrive in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Chinese tourists led by Li Zhongwen, standing vice-secretary of the Tumen City Committee of the Communist Party of China who participated in the ceremony for opening to traffic a tourist train for Mt. Chilbo, arrived at Namyang Station in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province on Saturday.
					
					 The first train left Namyang Station for the tourist resort the same day.

articles.title: Brazilian Party Delegation Arrives Here
articles.content:
Brazilian Party Delegation Arrives Here

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil led by First Vice-President Carlos Batista Lopes arrived here Saturday.

articles.title: International Trade Fair to Be Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
International Trade Fair to Be Held in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The 7th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair will be held at the Three-revolution Exhibition from October 17 to 20.
					
					 The fair will draw companies from different countries and regions including the DPRK, China, Netherlands, Germany, Malaysia, Switzerland, Sweden, Australia, Austria, Britain, Italy, the Czech Republic, France and Taipei of China.
					
					 Presented to the fair will be machine units, vehicles, metal and electronic products, building materials, agricultural, chemical, medical, light industrial products, foodstuffs, daily necessities, etc.
					
					 The fair will be helpful to promoting cooperation and exchange among countries and regions in the fields of trade, economy and science and technology.

articles.title: Premier Football League Continues in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Premier Football League Continues in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Premier football league matches are going on at Kim Il Sung Stadium as part of the national championship.
					
					 Eleven men's and eight women's teams are competing in the league matches. 
					
					 An official of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports told KCNA that many of the footballers who participated in the last World Cup belong to different teams participating in the matches.
					
					 Experts and football fans, in view of the results of the previous premier league, are expecting that the April 25 men's and women's teams, Rimyongsu men's team and Amnokgang women's team will prove successful in the current matches.
					
					 The matches, which started on October 1, will end on October 30.

articles.title: Party Founding Memorial Tower
articles.content:
Party Founding Memorial Tower

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Many people have visited the Party Founding Memorial Tower standing in the center of Munsu Street in Pyongyang with the approach of the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					
					 The memorial tower is indicative of the great feats of the WPK, which pioneered a new way for building a revolutionary party of Juche type under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The tower consists of a body portraying the WPK emblem, a circular band covering the body and a platform reflecting the history of the Party that originated from the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					
					 The inside surface of the band is inscribed with three large group sculptures showing the historical roots of the WPK, the might of the single-hearted unity of the leader, Party and people and the struggle of the Korean people for the independence of humankind.
					
					 Since the tower was erected in October Juche 84 (1995), millions of people, including overseas Koreans and foreigners, have visited it.

articles.title: Taesongsan Fun Fair
articles.content:
Taesongsan Fun Fair

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Taesongsan Fun Fair is situated at the foot of picturesque Mt. Taesong in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The fun fair, built under deep concern of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, was opened in October Juche 66 (1977). 
					
					 It covers 180 000 square meters. 
					
					 It includes many amusement apparatuses like jet coaster, mad mouse, bumper car, spacecraft and sliding boat. 
					
					 It is also furnished with beverage stores, restaurants and other service facilities.  
					
					 More than a million people, including foreigners, enjoy themselves in the fun fair every year.

articles.title: Onpho Hot Spring
articles.content:
Onpho Hot Spring 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- There is a famous hot spring in Kyongsong County, North Hamgyong Province, DPRK.
					
					 The Onpho Hot Spring, discovered about 500 years ago, spouts from underground as deep as 460-500 meters.
					
					 The 50-55 degrees centigrade water contains several kinds of minerals efficacious for neuralgia, arthritis and gynecopathy.
					
					 Its radon content is larger than any other springs in the country.
					
					 A health resort located around it has medical treatment facilities, as well as a rest home, bathhouse, cultural house and other entertainment facilities.
					
					 The spring draws a large number of people for its good curative effect.

articles.title: WPK Emblem, Symbolic of Working Masses' Party
articles.content:
WPK Emblem, Symbolic of Working Masses' Party 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The emblem of the Workers' Party of Korea consists of a hammer, sickle and writing brush.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, deeply aware of the position and role of intellectuals in building a new country after Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, regarded them as one of the driving forces in revolution. 
					
					 He suggested instituting the party emblem and told officials to have its design drawn. 
					
					 He told them the emblem should represent the workers, peasants and working intellectuals, symbolic of a united party of the working masses.  
					
					 When the design was ready, he found that a hammer stood vertically, flanked with a sickle and writing brush like fan ribs.
					
					 He said the hammer and sickle in the design were of foreign shape and that they should be drawn as Korean hammer and sickle.
					
					 He then said the three should be crossed in the middle of their handles with the brush standing vertically in the centre, little higher than others, and others slanting. His recommendation means that the workers and peasants should also acquire a high level of knowledge and culture needed for the building of an independent and sovereign state that is prosperous and civilized.
					
					 So, the emblem was redesigned as instructed by Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: DPRK Players Bag Medals in International Games
articles.content:
DPRK Players Bag Medals in International Games 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- At the 2011 Asian Youth and Juvenile Judo Championships held in Lebanon four DPRK women won gold medals in the 44kg, 48kg, 57kg and 63kg category events. They are Kim Jin A, Rim Song Sim, Paek Ri Hyang and Choe Saeppyol.
					
					 An Jae Yong, Jo Yong Il and Jang Yong Min bagged bronze medals in men's 55kg and 73kg category events.
					
					 The DPRK team defeated the Australian team 1:0 at the 2011 U-19 Asian Women's Football Championship on Saturday.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Calls for Earliest Possible End to U.S. Forces' Presence in South Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Calls for Earliest Possible End to U.S. Forces' Presence in S. Korea 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, a GI committed a sexual assault against a teenage girl student in south Korea. 
					
					 Most of the crimes committed by the U.S. forces in south Korea are generally not known. But awesome are some cases occasionally reported. 
					
					 The GI crimes are on the daily increase. 
					
					 A total of 377 GI crimes were reported last year, 183 in 2008 and 306 in 2009. 
					
					 Not a single day passes without crimes in south Korea owing to the violence of the U.S. forces. 
					
					 They are committing all sorts of crimes wherever they go in south Korea such as murder, plunder, rape and violence and degrading of nature and environment. 
					
					 On the strength of the unequal "SOFA", they seriously violate sovereignty and vital rights of the south Korean people. 
					
					 According to it, the U.S. forces have the right to try the crimes committed by GIs "while on duty" and it is they who are entitled to judge whether a GI committed a crime "while on duty" or not.
					
					 The south Korean authorities can neither appeal against any decision nor claim any damages when the U.S. forces reject any trial or declare any soldier not guilty. 
					
					 Some years ago, the U.S. forces declared not guilty those GIs who drove an armored car over the two girl students to death and whisked them away to the mainland, asserting "they were on duty".
					
					 The U.S. forces unhesitatingly buried poisonous chemical materials including defoliant in their bases in Waegwan and Puphyong and other parts of south Korea. 
					
					 Not only the dignity and sovereignty of the south Korean people but also their lives and properties are infringed upon as long as there exist occupation forces in south Korea. 
					
					 It is necessary to put an end to the U.S. military presence and domination over south Korea at an early date. 
					
					 It is anachronistic that the U.S. keeps south Korea under its military occupation still now when the Cold War had already demised long ago and the withdrawal of foreign troops has become an irresistible trend of the times.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses Denounced

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative authorities at a recent trial on appeal held at the puppet Suwon Local Court sentenced Hwang Kil Gyong, who posted an article praising the DPRK on an internet homepage, to ten months in prison, branding his deed as "an unpardonable act of going beyond the limit of blindly following the north".
					
					 Minju Joson Saturday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a serious violation of human rights as it is infringing upon the freedom and rights of a human being and brutal suppression of ideology.
					
					 Their assertion is preposterous, indeed.
					
					 Their vicious anti-DPRK campaign is barring the south Korean people from properly knowing about its reality.
					
					  For this reason Hwang opened an internet website "Cyber national defence headquarters" and posted articles on it, helping south Koreans know about the DPRK's reality. His deed deserves people's praise as it was a righteous action for the country and the nation.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the conservative group suppressed Hwang by linking his act with the DPRK. This is an undisguised challenge to the DPRK and an unpardonable treacherous and anti-reunification act as it blocks the reconciliation and unity of the nation and the improvement of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the conservative group to create terror-ridden atmosphere in the south Korean society through such brutal fascist suppression in a bid to keep the people from longing for the DPRK or turning out in the struggle for the independent reunification of the nation.
					
					 As facts prove, the conservative authorities have no will to improve the inter-Korean relations but are keen to escalate the confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: Iranian Nation Not Afraid of U.S.: Iranian President
articles.content:
Iranian Nation Not Afraid of U.S.: Iranian President

					 Tehran, October 7 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in a peech at a meeting on Wednesday clarified the firm stand of the people of his country not afraid of the U.S. threat.
					
					 U.S. imperialism has now become weaker than ever before and is on the decline because of wars in Afghanistan and Iraq and financial crisis, he said.
					
					 The Iranian nation is not afraid of any power and is united in going ahead on the right path, he noted.

articles.title: Indonesian President Refers to Issue of Bolstering Defense Capability
articles.content:
Indonesian President Refers to Issue of Bolstering Defense Capability

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, addressing the 66th anniversary celebration of the Indonesian Military on Wednesday, referred to the issue of bolstering the defense capability.
					
					 "It is very important to develop the armament (for the military)," the president said, adding: The government would increase defense budget by 35 percent in 2012, compared with this year.
					
					 He said that the increased budget is aimed at developing the armament of the country's military forces and improving the living condition of the soldiers.

articles.title: India Calls on UN to Adopt Comprehensive Convention against Terrorism
articles.content:
India Calls on UN to Adopt Comprehensive Convention against Terrorism

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- India called on the United Nations to adopt the comprehensive convention against international terrorism. Indian Rajya Sabha (Upper House of Parliament) Deputy Chairman K. Rahman Khan told this at the UN General Assembly session on October 5. 
					
					 Terrorism is a scourge of humanity, he said, adding that the adoption of the Comprehensive Convention on International Terrorism (CCIT) would provide a solid legal basis for the fight against terrorism.
					
					 The UN global counter-terrorism strategy is incomplete in the absence of such a comprehensive convention, he noted.
					
					 The CCIT is a proposed treaty which intends to criminalize all forms of international terrorism and deny terrorists and their financiers and supporters, he stressed.

articles.title: Palestinian People's Struggle Supported by Iran's Majlis Speaker
articles.content:
Palestinian People's Struggle Supported by Iran's Majlis Speaker

					 Tehran, October 7 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani in a diplomatic appearance on October 4 clarified the stand of his country supporting the Palestinian people's struggle.
					
					 The hegemonic forces are making desperate efforts to undermine the resistance of the people of the revolutionary countries, he said, stressing: The resistance is the only way for the Palestinian nation to restore its aspirations. 
					
					 He called upon all the Islamic nations to get united with the objective of eradicating the Zionist regime.

articles.title: Sudan Rejects U.S. Incentives for Ceasefire
articles.content:
Sudan Rejects U.S. Incentives for Ceasefire

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The deputy chairman of the National Congress Party of Sudan in a press conference on October 4 rejected the U.S. promise for aid.
					
					 As regards the recent report that the U.S. promised to give aid to Sudan, he said that his country is not interested in such promise at all.
					
					 Meanwhile a spokesman for the Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs said that America has kept promising to provide assistance to Sudan year after year.
					
					 He further reiterated that any American claims of providing incentives to Sudan would be associated with the U.S. elections where the U.S. president or the U.S. Congress directs the message to the U.S. voters and not to Sudan.

articles.title: Bolivia Condemns U.S. Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Bolivia Condemns U.S. Smear Campaign

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Bolivian minister of Interior on October 3 condemned the U.S. smear campaign against his country.
					
					 The U.S. is using the anti-drug trafficking issue for a campaign against Bolivia, he said, denouncing the U.S. for linking the progressive government of his country with drug and terrorism.
					
					 His country has registered many achievements in anti-drug campaign without help of the U.S., he noted, stressing that Bolivia does not need any military base to combat drug trafficking.

articles.title: Palestinian Official Condemns Israeli Maltreatment of Prisoners
articles.content:
Palestinian People's Struggle Supported by Iran's Majlis Speaker

					 Tehran, October 7 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani in a diplomatic appearance on October 4 clarified the stand of his country supporting the Palestinian people's struggle.
					
					 The hegemonic forces are making desperate efforts to undermine the resistance of the people of the revolutionary countries, he said, stressing: The resistance is the only way for the Palestinian nation to restore its aspirations. 
					
					 He called upon all the Islamic nations to get united with the objective of eradicating the Zionist regime.

articles.title: Iran Clarifies Stand to Defend Regional Peace and Security
articles.content:
Iran Clarifies Stand to Defend Regional Peace and Security

					 Tehran, October 7 (KCNA) -- Iran's minister of Defense and Armed Forces Logistics in a diplomatic appearance on October 4 clarified the stand of his country to defend the regional peace and security.
					
					 Presence of foreign countries is main obstacle in restoring peace and tranquility in the region, he said, adding that it has brought bloodshed and mass killings, violence and insecurity, boosting terrorism.
					
					 Peace and security of the region should be maintained by the countries in the region themselves, he said, calling for boosting cooperation among countries. The armed forces of Iran will make positive contributions to defending the regional peace and security.

articles.title: Belorussian Parliamentary Demands U.S. Lift Blockade against Cuba
articles.content:
Belorussian Parliamentary Demands U.S. Lift Blockade against Cuba

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The president of the Belorussian Parliament's Commission International Affairs in a diplomatic appearance on Monday demanded the U.S. lift the blockade against Cuba.
					
					 He denounced the U.S. for its ceaseless blockade against Cuba and ratified the position of the Belorussian government to support the Cuban struggle against the blockade.
					
					 Belarus will make positive efforts to demand the U.S. implement the UN resolution on ending the blockade against Cuba, he stressed.

articles.title: Vietnam, Cambodia Damaged by Flood
articles.content:
Vietnam, Cambodia Damaged by Flood

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Southern and Central Vietnam recently suffered from flood accompanied by heavy rains. The flood left 13 persons dead and five others wounded as of October 4.
					
					 In addition, almost 30,000 houses were inundated and thousands of hectares of rice and crop fields destroyed.
					
					 Flood damage caused by heavy rains is expanding in Cambodia.
					
					 Death toll reached 164 and 215 600 houses were damaged as of October 4 due to the flood that hit the country since early August, according to the government release. 291,000 hectares of paddy fields were wasted and more than 2 200 km-long roads destroyed.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Myanmar and Thailand agreed to boost bilateral cooperation in trade, communication and other fields on October 5.
					
					 China and Venezuela signed an agreement on Oct. 4 to jointly build a container terminal in Venezuela's main port of Puerto Cabello.
					
					 Chile and Panama on Oct. 3 inked an agreement on exchange and cooperation in the cultural field.

articles.title: Gun-related Crimes Rampant in U.S.
articles.content:
Gun-related Crimes Rampant in U.S.

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Two people were killed and at least six others wounded in a shooting on Wednesday at a Northern California cement plant and quarry. A 45-year-old male suspect in the shooting was still at large.
					
					 An elderly woman, her granddaughter and the girl's boyfriend were shot dead on the Crow Indian Reservation in Montana on Tuesday.  
					
					 A series of bloody gun-related crimes are sparking social uneasiness and horror in the U.S.

articles.title: New Zealand Condemns Japan's Plan to Continue Antarctic Whaling
articles.content:
New Zealand Condemns Japan's Plan to Continue Antarctic Whaling

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The foreign minister of New Zealand condemned Japan on Wednesday for intending to continue its so-called research whaling in the Antarctic Ocean, criticizing it as being entirely disrespectful of the strong concerns expressed by the Australian and New Zealand people.
					
					 He also described Japan's claims of whaling for "scientific purposes" as highly dubious.

articles.title: Accidents in U.S., Italy
articles.content:
Accidents in U.S., Italy

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Fifteen people were injured Tuesday morning after a truck collided with a light rail train in the U.S. city of Houston, Texas.
					
					 A building collapsed in southern Italy on Monday, killing two people, while six others are still buried under the debris.

articles.title: Russian FM Rejects U.S. Unreasonable Decision
articles.content:
Russian FM Rejects U.S. Unreasonable Decision

					 Moscow, October 7 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Russia in a commentary on October 6 bluntly rejected the U.S. decision to deploy missile defense system on the coast of Spain.
					
					 The U.S. decided to deploy on the coast of Spain four warships equipped with SM-3 interceptor missile and Aegis system. Russia is compelled to be vigilant against the U.S. current step to build missile defense system in Europe in a phased way, the commentary said.
					
					 The Russian government can never tolerate the U.S. measure to adopt the unreasonable decision which would adversely affect the regional security and stability without taking into consideration the opinions of all the countries concerned, it stressed.

articles.title: U.S. MD Moves Continues
articles.content:
U.S. MD Moves Continues 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. conducted another test for building missile defense system on October 5.
					
					 The test was to simultaneously intercept short- and medium-range ballistic missiles by THAAD, according to the U.S. Defense Department. It is the first time that the system was put into test.

articles.title: U.S. Swept by Waves of Protest Demos
articles.content:
U.S. Swept by Waves of Protest Demos

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Unprecedented demos are taking place in the United States these days in protest against exploitation and oppression by capital, shaking all fabrics of society.
					
					 The first demo kicked off in Wall Street on Sept. 17. It has been going on for three consecutive weeks. 
					
					 The demonstrators put up slogan "Let's Occupy Wall Street".
					
					 Young Americans formed a mainstream of the ranks of demonstrators at first. But they were joined by people from all walks of life who varied in their ages including day laborers, poor and unemployed Americans as well as employees of companies and housewives. 
					
					 Their actions included marches, sit-in strikes, occupation of bridges and various other forms of protests and non-stop protests at night. 
					
					 These actions spilled over to different parts of the U.S. including Los Angeles, Chicago and San Francisco all of a sudden. 
					
					  It was reported that organizations were inaugurated in 146 cities of 46 states and the capital city as of Tuesday to supervise demos.
					
					 The waves of demo which swept the U.S. recently is an expression of the grievances against the mounting social contradiction resulting from the worsening unemployment and the widening gap between the poor and the rich due to the serious economic crisis.
					
					 It also reflects the public opinion critical of the authorities and the exploiting classes who drove the country into such serious phase.
					
					 Foreign media predict that demos will go on and spill over to large-scale protests and create something unprecedented in the future. 
					
					 Such protests as what is happening in the U.S. are expected to take place in other capitalist countries.
					
					 It was reported that slogan "Let's Occupy Melbourne!" has already appeared in Australia and "Let's Occupy Toronto Stock Market!" in Canada and organizations were formed in Japan, Germany and other countries to stage demos under the slogan "Let's Occupy!"

articles.title: Reinstatement of Comfort Women Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Reinstatement of Comfort Women Called for in S. Korea 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Meeting, an organization of former unconverted long-term prisoners of south Korea, held the 990th Wednesday rally for settling the issue of comfort women for the imperial Japanese army in Seoul on October 5. 
					
					 Present at the rally were comfort women victims, former unconverted long-term prisoners, representatives of civic and public organizations and members of Japanese organizations. 
					
					 Speakers said that a lot of Koreans were taken to the battlefield of war of aggression during the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists and met deaths. The victims are still suffering from pains. 
					
					 Japan has made neither apology nor reparation for the crimes of sexual slavery by the Japanese imperialists, an issue pending immediate solution, they said.
					
					 They said they would stage solidarity activities with different countries with the 1 000th Wednesday rally due in December as an occasion. 
					
					 A statement adopted at the rally urged the "government" to make efforts for the reinstatement of the comfort women victims and the proper settlement of history.

articles.title: Suppression of Workers Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Workers Flayed in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Veterans of the civic and social organizations of south Korea in a press conference in Seoul on October 5 issued a declaration demanding the authorities stop the suppression of the workers in their struggle for the right to existence.
					
					 The declaration said:
					
					 Kim Jin Suk, dismissed worker of the Hanjin Heavy Industry, has been staging a sit-in for more than 270 days in a crane at the factory.
					
					 This is a proof for the present reality in which the workers' life is being pushed to the brink of a cliff.
					
					 People are supporting the workers' struggle, exclaiming the dismissal leads to death, but the "government" and the business side have failed to take any step, it deplored.
					
					 Instead, the "government", the ruling party and police are cracking down on the workers in their struggle for the right to existence, it said.
					
					 It is a unanimous desire of the workers to live in the world free from lay-off and part-time jobs, the declaration said, calling upon all the people to pool their efforts to achieve the labor right.
					
					 It urged the authorities to immediately stop the suppression of the workers.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest FTA
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest FTA
						

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Farmers and fishermen from across south Korea, over 20 000 in all, met in Youido, Seoul on Oct. 6 to protest against the conclusion of the shackling south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement." 
					
					 Speakers accused the present "government" and the "Grand National Party" of working hard to railroad the motion calling for the ratification of the proposal on FTA through the "National Assembly."
					
					 The conclusion of the FTA is little different from giving up agriculture, fishery and stockbreeding, they said, adding:
					
					 It threatens the lives of the peasants and fishermen.
					
					 They can never allow the shackling FTA to be concluded as it serves the U.S. interests only, they contended.
					
					 They would punish without fail the assemblymen who consent or side with the NA passage of the motion, they warned.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop at once the moves to conclude the agreement and open a hearing to disclose the inside story of the negotiations that had been held so far.
					
					 Noting that there is no other way but to struggle, they called on all of them to pool their efforts to check the conclusion of the FTA.
					
					 At the end of the meeting its participants held a demonstration march.
					
					 They went to the place where representatives of the organizations under the Agro-stock Emergency Committee for Measures against the Conclusion of South Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement were staging a sit-in from Sept. 28 to encourage them.

articles.title: Achievements in Researches into Fish Farming
articles.content:
Achievements in Researches into Fish Farming

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Successes have been made in the research into pisciculture in the DPRK. They included the introduction and breeding of fishes of new species and the development of efficacious fish food and additive.
					
					 An energetic work was conducted to breed fries which grow fast and healthy while consuming less food and propagate them. As a result, Ryongjong fish has spread throughout the country.
					
					 Successes have been made in the research to make fish food locally available as evidenced by the production of profitable different kinds of assorted food and multi-additive.
					
					 Among them are ferment fish food made by use of protein-rich grass, the additive fish food produced by use of Kumgang medicinal stone, etc. They were highly estimated at the recent national public presentation of scientific and technological achievements in the field of fish farming.
					
					 The technology for breeding fish suited to the specific conditions of the country has been researched and completed. 
					
					 Scientific and technological issues helpful to improving the quality of water in fish breeding grounds have been settled.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Legal Document for Space Cooperation
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Legal Document for Space Cooperation

					 Moscow, October 7 (KCNA) -- Valentina Matvienko, chairman of the Russian Federation Council, recently called upon the inter-parliamentary assembly of the Commonwealth of the Independent States (CIS) to draw up a legal document governing cooperation in the space field.
					
					 Matvienko said the legal basis of the international treaty for the cooperation among CIS member nations fails to meet the demand of the era.
					
					 The chairman suggested that a draft convention concerning cooperation for a peaceful research in and use of space be drawn up to be committed to deliberation by the CIS Council of Heads of State.

articles.title: 13th Congress of Young Communist League Held in Chile
articles.content:
13th Congress of Young Communist League Held in Chile 

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The 13th Congress of the Young Communist League of Chile was held in Santiago de Chile recently. 
					
					 It was attended by an estimated 320 representatives selected from various parts of the country.
					
					 A new leadership body was elected at the congress.

articles.title: CPV Plenum Opens in Hanoi
articles.content:
CPV Plenum Opens in Hanoi

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The 3rd plenary session of the 11th Communist Party of Vietnam (CPV) opened in Hanoi on Thursday. 
					
					 The plenary session will review the country's development plans and some of the party regulations. 
					
					 General Secretary Nguyen Phu Trong in his opening speech said that reviewing the country's socio-economic development plans is one of the party's regular works.  
					
					 The plenum continues till Oct. 10.

articles.title: Submarine's Extra Rescue Compartment Tested in Russia
articles.content:
Submarine's Extra Rescue Compartment Tested in Russia 

					 Moscow, October 7 (KCNA) -- An extra rescue compartment for nuclear submarine was tested successfully in a vessel repair center in Severodbinsk, Russia, some time ago. 
					
					 The multipurpose compartment, the first of its kind in the country, enables crew to come to the surface of the water when an accident occurs.  
					
					 It will be reportedly sent to the Russian Navy in November.

articles.title: China Urges International Cooperation against Terrorist Threat
articles.content:
China Urges International Cooperation against Terrorist Threat

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- China's permanent representative to UN called for strengthening international cooperation to suppress terrorist threat.
					
					 Addressing the UN General Assembly meeting on Monday, Li Baodong said that with terrorists' activities covering the whole world, the collective cooperation intensified worldwide is the only choice for effectively containing terrorist threat.
					
					 An identity of view should be reached as early as possible as regards a draft package agreement concerning international terrorism, Li added.

articles.title: DPRK's Reunification Proposal Favored in Thailand
articles.content:
DPRK's Reunification Proposal Favored in Thailand

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Chanai Longoen, chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association, issued a statement on October 4 on the 31st anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					
					 This proposal advanced by President Kim Il Sung is the most fair and aboveboard proposal for reunification as it correctly reflects the reality of the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 A unified government of the federal state calls for respecting the will of all parties and groups and people from all walks of life in the north and the south and bars one party from forcing its will on the other party.
					
					 This will deprive the north and the south of any ground to stand in confrontation or fight each other due to their differing interests and remove the basic source of military conflict.
					
					 The historic June 15 joint declaration stipulates that the north and the south recognize the commonness in the north side's low-level federation proposal and the south side's confederation proposal and shall work for reunification in this direction in the future. The present ruling forces of south Korea came out with nonsensical "unification" logic, disregarding the above-said commonness. This is, in essence, little short of a war action under the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula where the differing ideology and system have existed in the north and the south.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the DPRK government and people in their struggle to reunify the country independently and peacefully according to the DFRK founding proposal.

articles.title: WPK's Anniversary Marked in Peru, Ethiopia
articles.content:
WPK's Anniversary Marked in Peru, Ethiopia

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru and the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea issued bulletins on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The library in its bulletin on Sept. 30 edited a photo of leader Kim Jong Il, photos on WPK's flag and military parade celebrating the 65th anniversary of the WPK and a commemorative article.
					
					 The article said President Kim Il Sung strengthened the party, guided by the Juche idea, and built socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The Peruvian people warmly congratulate the WPK on its 66th anniversary and express conviction that the DPRK will further consolidate the single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the masses, it noted.
					
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea in the 29th issue of its bulletin on October 1 carried an article, which said:
					
					 The Conference of the WPK held in September 2010 reelected Kim Jong Il to be general secretary of the WPK. This was a clear indication that the Korean people absolutely support and trust him and entirely entrust their destiny and future to the WPK.

articles.title: Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Awarded Special Prizes at Intl' Pot Plant Exhibition
articles.content:
Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Awarded Special Prizes at Intl' Pot Plant Exhibition

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia were awarded special prizes of the International Pot Plant Exhibition of the 2011 World Horticultural Expo in Xi'an.
					
					 Displayed at the exhibition were thousands of wonderful pot plants of more than 130 species presented by the DPRK, the Netherlands, Germany, Japan and other countries and many units of China.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place in Xi'an, China on Monday.
					
					 A special exhibition prize went to Kimilsungia and a special cultivation prize to Kimjongilia. The diplomas were handed to the head of the DPRK delegation of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee.

articles.title: DPRK's Development Introduced in Indonesia
articles.content:
DPRK's Development Introduced in Indonesia

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian paper Kompas on Sept. 23 carried a travelogue on the DPRK contributed by a member of the delegation of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle.
					
					 The article conveyed the impressions he got after watching the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" at the May Day Stadium.
					
					 The extravaganza vividly reflects the reality of the daily developing DPRK, the article said, and went on:
					
					 Many people would ask us who visited the DPRK about the level of the DPRK's development. Such question is raised because of the U.S. misinformation on the DPRK. 
					
					 Not only Pyongyang but many local cities have been successfully spruced up. The DPRK has made rapid progress in recent years.
					
					 The West's media claim that the Korean people cannot do anything as they wish under the socialist system but this is a sheer lie.
					
					 Had the DPRK not made any progress, it would not have produced nuclear weapons. It has almost completed the large-scale hydraulic power station in a matter of little more than two years which would have taken more than ten years at an ordinary pace. This is a clear proof that the DPRK has developed.
					
					 The Korean people are advancing, foreseeing a rosy future.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Media

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries carried special write-ups on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					The Bangladeshi paper Ekota on October 3 said in an article that general secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the original Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism. Under his leadership the overall national power of the country has been remarkably increased and the DPRK had access to even powerful nuclear deterrent, it noted.
					
					 The Korean people absolutely support and trust him and entirely entrust their destiny and future to the WPK headed by him, the article said.
					
					 Another paper of Bangladesh Natun Katha said in an article on the same day:
					
					 The reality of the DPRK proves the scientific accuracy and truth of the Juche idea, the guiding idea of the WPK.
					
					 The idea of believing in people as in Heaven and slogans "Let the Whole Party Go among the Masses!" and "We Serve the People!" are the fundamental principles and the starting point of all activities of the WPK.
					
					 The WPK led by Kim Jong Il will always emerge victorious.
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on October 2 carried an article introducing the secret of steady victories of the WPK.
					
					 Citta Aperta Radio of Italy on Sept. 30 said that the WPK is winning victory after victory despite all ordeals and difficulties. The credit for it is the great Songun politics, it stressed.

articles.title: Construction Site in DPRK Introduced by ITAR-TASS
articles.content:
Construction Site in DPRK Introduced by ITAR-TASS

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- ITAR-TASS of Russia introduced on Tuesday the construction site in Mansudae area where the new Pyongyang Speed in the era of Songun is being created.
					
					 The agency said that new apartment houses are springing up in Mansudae area, the center of the capital city of the DPRK where the statue of President Kim Il Sung stands. 
					
					 Structural construction of modern multistoried and skyscraping apartment houses is making rapid progress, it noted, and went on:
					
					The construction is under way according to the plan of general secretary Kim Jong Il to turn Pyongyang into a more modern and beautiful city of people.
					
					 The construction is undertaken with locally produced materials, especially cement and steel. Best quality is ensured in the construction of all buildings, it added.
					
					 The construction of apartment houses in Pyongyang proves that the purpose of the policies of the Workers' Party of Korea is to promote the people's well-being.

articles.title: Indian Party Reiterates Its Will to Boost Comradely Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Indian Party Reiterates Its Will to Boost Comradely Relations with WPK

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of India (Marxist) will continue boosting the comradely relations with the Workers' Party of Korea in the struggle for building socialism against imperialism. 
					
					 Prakash Karat, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), said this when meeting with Rim Hoe Song, DPRK ambassador to India, on October 3.
					
					 He said he was pleased to learn that leader Kim Jong Il made undying contributions to consolidating and strengthening the traditional DPRK-Russia and DPRK-China friendly relations by visiting the Siberian and Far East Regions of Russia and the Northeast Region of China.
					
					 The proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by President Kim Il Sung is the most realistic way for achieving the reunification of Korea, he said, adding:
					
					 The Communist Party of India (Marxist) will extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to accelerate socialist construction and reunify the country.

articles.title: WPK's Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK's Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Bangladesh, Romania and Switzerland between October 1 and 3 to mark the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were photos on the feats President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il performed in founding and strengthening the WPK.
					
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said that the 66 year-long history of the WPK founded by Kim Il Sung is a glorious history in which it turned the DPRK into a socialist power and led the human cause of independence to a brilliant victory.
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union, noted that the WPK has grown to be an invincible party thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said that the reelection of Kim Jong Il as general secretary of the WPK at its conference last year provided a firm guarantee for successfully carrying forward and accomplishing generation after generation the Korean revolution which started with the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					
					 The achievements made in the DPRK have brought hope to progressive mankind and greatly inspired them in their struggle to achieve independence, he noted.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Switzerland.

articles.title: En EE.UU. prosiguen manifestaciones de indignados
articles.content:
En EE.UU. prosiguen manifestaciones de indignados

					 Pyongyang, 9 de octubre (ACNC) -- En Estados Unidos prosiguen durante tres semanas las manifestaciones de protesta sin precedentes contra la explotacion y represion de los capitalistas. 
					
					 En estas manifestaciones, iniciadas el 17 de septiembre pasado en Wall Street de la ciudad de Nueva York por los jovenes bajo la consigna de "Ocupa Wall Street", toman parte ahora las masas populares de distintos estratos y edades, entre ellos, los jornaleros, los pobres, los desempleados, los oficinistas y las amas de casa.
					
					 Ellos desplegaron dia y noche la marcha de protesta, la huelga con brazos caidos, la ocupacion de puente, etc.
					
					 Las manifestaciones se extendieron en un instante a todo el pais incluso Los Angeles, Chicago y San Francisco. 
					
					 Segun trascendidos, quedaron organizadas el dia 4 en 146 ciudades y capitales de 46 Estados las organizaciones para presidir las manifestaciones.
					
					 El movimiento de protesta que se libra por todas las partes del territorio estadounidense es la expresion de descontento por las contradicciones sociales que se agrandan debido a la constante crisis economica y refleja la opinion publica contra las autoridades y la clase explotadora que llevaron el pais a esa situacion catastrofica.
					
					 Los medios de prensa extranjeros pronostican que continuaran las manifestaciones y se desarrollaran como una accion de protesta de gran envergadura acarreando una situacion no vista. 
					
					 Ademas, se preve que las manifestaciones similares se reproduciran en otros paises capitalistas.
					
					 Ya aparecieron en Australia y Canada las consignas como "!Ocupa Melbourne!" y "!Ocupa el mercado de acciones de Toronto!", respectivamente.
					
					 Y nacieron en Japon, Alemania y otros paises las organizaciones para librar las manifestaciones bajo la consigna de "!Ocupemos!".

articles.title: En plena marcha la super-liga de futbol
articles.content:
En plena marcha la super-liga de futbol

					 Pyongyang, 8 de octubre (ACNC) -- Se realiza desde el dia primero en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la super-liga de futbol en el marco del Campeonato Nacional.
					
					 En el presente evento participan once equipos masculinos y 8 femeninos.
					
					 Los futbolistas de cada equipo muestran excelentes movimientos practicando los sistemas de tacticas peculiares.
					
					 Citado por la ACNC, un funcionario del Ministerio de Deportes dijo que en el presente certamen participan muchos jugadores renombrados en las ediciones anteriores de la Copa Mundial de Futbol.
					
					 Se preven que los equipos de ambos sexos del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, el once masculino del Conjunto Deportivo Ri Myong Su y el femenino del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, que sobresalieron en las super-ligas anteriores, lograrian buenas notas tambien en el presente certamen.
					
					 El torneo se realiza a manera de todos contra todos y terminara el dia 30.

articles.title: Pyongyang espera VII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal
articles.content:
Pyongyang espera VII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal

					 Pyongyang, 8 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tendra lugar del dia 17 al 20 en la capitalina Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la VII Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Otonal de Pyongyang.
					
					 En esta feria participaran las companias de varios paises y regiones, entre otros, la RPDC, China, Holanda, Alemania, Malasia, Suiza, Suecia, Australia, Austria, Gran Bretana, Italia, Checo, Francia, Taipei de China.
					
					 En la ocasion se exhibiran las maquinas, los medios de transporte, los aparatos metalurgicos y electronicos, los materiales de construccion, los productos agricolas y quimicos, los medicamentos, los articulos de industria ligera, los alimentos, los  articulos de uso diario, entre otras mercancias. 
					
					 El certamen contribuira a desarrollar la cooperacion y el intercambio entre los paises y regiones en el comercio exterior, la economia, la ciencia y tecnica.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a mostrar impetu de Corea de Songun
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a mostrar impetu de Corea de Songun

					 Pyongyang, 8 de octubre (ACNC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun difundio hoy un articulo dedicado al primer aniversario de la publicacion de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "El Partido del Trabajo de Corea es el gran Partido que continua y lleva a cabo la causa revolucionaria del camarada        Kim Il Sung".
					
					 La obra publicada el dia 8 de octubre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche dilucida que al continuar y desarrollar la idea de dar prioridad a fusil, idea de Songun del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el PTC abrio con la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun y la politica de Songun, el nuevo camino de la revolucion hacia la victoria y la epoca del gran auge  en la revolucion y la construccion.
					
					 La obra esta penetrada por la ferrea voluntad del Dirigente de realizar hasta el fin la idea y la causa del Presidente al intensificar el partido y elevar sin cesar el papel directivo del partido.
					
					 La obra infunde la inagotable fuerza y coraje al ejercito y el pueblo de Corea que en acato al espiritu de la Conferencia del PTC avanzan hacia la nueva victoria de la revolucion de Juche, subraya el articulo.
					
					 Gracias a la direccion del Dirigente, la causa socialista iniciada por el Presidente avanza en una nueva y alta etapa de desarrollo. Para el PTC, la idea del Lider es la idea del Partido y la direccion del Lider es la direccion del partido, senala y agrega que en la historia de la edificacion del partido revolucionario de la clase obrera no hay el partido como el PTC que al enaltecer como eterno lider al gran fundador y constructor del partido, mantiene firmemente la unificacion de la idea y la direccion y conduce siempre a la victoria la causa socialista.
					
					 La direccion del PTC es la linea vital de la revolucion continua, enfatiza y anade que para nosotros no hay otro remedio que hacer hasta el fin la revolucion bajo la bandera roja socialista.
					
					 Recalca que el socialismo de Juche que avanza bajo la direccion del PTC es la ciencia y la victoria.
					
					 Enfatiza que es inconmovible la conviccion de nuestro ejercito y pueblo de seguir siempre al Dirigente por el camino de la revolucion iniciada por el Presidente.
					
					 Finaliza llamando a todos a unirse compactamente en torno al Comite Central del Partido encabezado por el Dirigente para hacer gala del impetu de Corea de Songun y glorificar Corea como potencia socialista de Juche.
